title: Conquering the AWS Certified Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äî Associate: My Roadmap
to Success
summary: The AWS Certified Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äî Associate exam is divided into
four main domains. The exam is geared toward professionals who not only
understand machine learning principles but also possess a ¬†robust¬†AWS skill set.
Anton R. Gordon shares how he approached this certification.
author: Anton R Gordon

title: Engineering the Future: Common Threads in Data, Software, and Artificial
Intelligence
subtitle: How recognizing cross-discipline commonalities not only enhances recruitment
strategies but also supports adaptable IT architectures.
summary: Traditional software application engineering, data engineering and artificial
intelligence (AI/ML) form large silos today. While the different tasks were
assumed to be largely distinct, the reality is that they are not. This is a
problem that needs to be addressed.
author: Bernd Wessely

title: Data Science All Algorithm Cheatsheet 2025
subtitle: Stories, strategies, and secrets to choosing the perfect algorithm.
summary: Every algorithm has its own strengths and weaknesses. The key is to know when
and how to use them. This is a guide to the best ways to use each algorithm.
It's also a guide on how to get the most out of your data. For more information
on the algorithm, visit the official website.
author: Ritesh Gupta

title: Why Artificial Intelligence Cannot Beat Human Writers
summary: The main difference between a human writer and AI is its creativity. Human
writer writes on the basis of their personal experience and emotions. They try
to include their unique voice and perspective in their work. Though AI can copy
human style and format but it is lack in creativity which can only be given by
human experience.
author: Rahul

title: Machine Learning Algorithms Cheat Sheet for Data Scientists üß†ü§ñ
subtitle: Simplified Explanations, Real-World Examples, and Quick References
summary: Machine learning is full of algorithms, and each one has its strengths,
weaknesses, and applications. It‚Äôs essential to know when and how to use them in
order to solve problems properly as a data scientist. This cheat sheet will take
you through the most popular machine learning algorithms.
author: Ritesh Gupta

title: My Machine Learning Journey: Perfect Roadmap for Beginners
summary: My journey in ML has been anything but traditional. I started with a project-
based approach focusing on projects over theory. This ‚Äúcode-first, theory-later‚Äù
method helped me learn ML in a practical, hands-on way. I learn best out of
necessity. When faced with a challenge, I find resources, understand them, and
take action. This ‚Äúlearn as you go‚Äù approach keeps my journey practical and
focused on my career goals. All my internships so far have come from projects I
built, not just theoretical...
author: Ashu Jha

title: How artificial intelligence is overcoming natural stupidity
summary: More than 50% of Americans claim to believe in at least one of the many
conspiracy theories out there. This is the backfire effect, which leads us to
continue believing in something despite the availability of new information that
firmly contradicts it. One of the best I‚Äôve seen to explain this kind of
question is this long comic by The Oatmeal.
author: Enrique Dans

title: Artificial Intelligence: Goldman Sachs says no
summary: The total market for Generative AI is estimated to be $1.5 billion over the next
ten years. It could potentially be used in global enterprise software,
healthcare and financial services, according to Goldman Sachs. But the hype is
fading and some are questioning the value of the technology.
author: Dave Coker

title: 5 Data Structures That Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists Must Know
subtitle: A Comprehensive Guide to Efficiency and Scalability of Data in ML and Deep
Learning
summary: In machine learning (ML), the performance and scalability of your models often
depend on the underlying data structures you choose. Arrays, heaps, hash tables,
trees, and graphs empower models to run faster, consume less memory, and handle
more complex tasks.
author: Joseph Robinson, Ph.D.

title: Effective Model Version Management in Machine Learning Projects
summary: In machine learning (ML) projects, one of the most critical components is
version management. Unlike traditional software development, managing an ML
project involves not only the source code but also data and models that evolve
over time. In this blog post, we will explore the best practices for managing ML
models and experiments effectively.
author: Salman Anwaar

title: The Fundamental Mathematics of Machine Learning
subtitle: A Deep Dive into Vector Norms, Linear Algebra, Calculus

title: How to Ace Machine Learning Interviews: My Personal Playbook
subtitle: Resources that helped me prepare for ML interview rounds
summary: Machine learning interviews can be a challenging journey, but with the right
resources and planning, you can navigate it confidently. This article won‚Äôt
cover general software engineering interview rounds like DSA coding or
specialized roles like Data Analyst. Always confirm with your recruiter if there
will be ML coding questions in any of the rounds.
author: Kartik Singhal

title: ICML 2024 Top Papers : What‚Äôs New in Machine Learning ?
summary: One of this year‚Äôs resolutions is to share papers from the leading AI
conferences to learn about the latest updates. These occasions are typically
where trends and innovations in areas like ML and Computer Vision emerge.
Furthermore, summer is an ideal time for this, as many such events take place
during this period. For this week‚Äôs article, I propose to explore the papers
presented at ICML, the International Conference on Machine Learning, currently
taking place from July 21 to 27, 2024, in...
author: Djohra IBERRAKEN

title: Uplift Modeling: Advanced Customer Targeting with Causal Machine Learning
summary: Exploring the Concepts, Algorithms, and Code with CausalML TL; DR: In recent
years, algorithms combining causal inference and machine learning have been a
hot topic. In this article, I will introduce Uplift Modeling, a powerful
technique for advanced customer targeting. We‚Äôll explore its objectives,
underlying concepts, and key algorithms, followed by a case study using
CausalML. If you prefer to dive straight into the sample code, please refer to
my . I‚Äôd be thrilled if you could leave a...
author: Hajime Takeda

title: The New Face of Artificial Intelligence?
subtitle: Researchers try putting living skin on a tiny robot, and it‚Äôs creepy AF
summary: A team at the University of Tokyo has figured out how to anchor living skin to a
small robot face. The 3D facial mould is made from collagen and elastin. The
robot face smiled for the camera as it posed for a photo.
author: Jeff Hayward

title: Unlocking the Potential of Recursion Theory in Artificial Intelligence
summary: This essay explores the role of recursion theory in AI, highlighting its impact
on algorithm design, problem-solving, and system optimization. The results
showcase improved algorithmic performance and reliability, especially in safety-
critical applications. The conclusions emphasize that recursions theory is a
foundational tool in AI.
author: Everton Gomede, PhD

title: The Easiest Way To Stay Up to Date With Machine Learning.
subtitle: Read 10x more relevant articles by building the most efficient system for
tracking and organizing machine learning & engineering articles.
summary: Working in the data science industry is becoming increasingly challenging.
Everything is moving so fast, and we are expected to stay up to date with the
latest tech. In the generative AI space, tech that was created one year ago
seems outdated today. If you leave frameworks for six months, you will need to
get onboarded again.
author: Serop Baghdadlian

title: OpenAI Confirms the Arrival of GPT-5, Poised to Bring Huge Improvements to
Artificial Intelligence üöÄ
summary: A netizen posted a GPT5 countdown post on x, saying that it was a conclusion
drawn from clues from various platforms. The comment section has reached a
climax with all kinds of opinions coming out. The generative AI company, led by
Sam Altman, is on track to launch GPT-5 sometime in the middle of the year.
author: Choco

title: Probability Theory for Data Science and Machine Learning Engineers
subtitle: From Basic Set Theory to Bayesian Inference
summary: Probability theory is at the core of statistical analysis and machine learning.
Mastering it is essential to understanding and developing robust models as a
data scientist. This blog will walk you through key concepts in probability
theory, from the basics of Set Theory to Advanced Bayesian inference.
author: Joseph Robinson, Ph.D.

title: From Jupyter to Production: Deploying Machine Learning Models Like a Pro
summary: Data scientists often build and test models in environments like Jupyter
Notebook. Getting these models to production involves several additional steps.
In this guide, we‚Äôll walk through the complete process of taking a machine
learning model from a J upyter notebook and deploying it into a live production
environment.
author: Ritesh Gupta

title: GenAI is Reshaping Data Science Teams
subtitle: Challenges, opportunities, and the evolving role of data scientists
summary: Generative AI (GenAI) opens the door to faster development cycles, minimized
technical and maintenance efforts, and innovative use cases that before seemed
out of reach. At the same time, it brings new risks ‚Äî like hallucinations, and
dependencies on third-party APIs. For Data Scientists and Machine Learning
teams, this evolution has a direct impact on their roles. A new type of AI
project has appeared, with part of the AI already implemented by external model
providers (OpenAI, Anthropic,...
author: Anna Via

title: The Most Expensive Data Science Mistake I‚Äôve Witnessed in My Career
subtitle: Why true success in machine learning goes beyond optimizing a single metric
summary: This was my first time witnessing a data science ‚Äúmistake‚Äô in a business
context. This was a very costly error from both a financial and operational
perspective. The downstream impact and reverberating effects it had across the
company. This issue impacted every team and we all worked tirelessly for months
after.
author: Claudia Ng

title: Don‚Äôt Be Afraid to Use Machine Learning for Simple Tasks
subtitle: A common misconception across industries
summary: Many professionals view machine learning as advanced technology that you deploy
when other approaches fail. In their mind, it‚Äôs a sophisticated tool reserved
for problems too complex for conventional methods. Sometimes, those comments are
valid, making machine learning the wrong technology. But more often, they stem
from a false‚Ä¶
author: Oscar Leo

title: The Hidden Cost of Modern Day Artificial Intelligence Boom
summary: The rapid evolution of AI technology contributes to electronic waste (e-waste)
and necessitates continuous resource extraction for hardware production. The
energy used for training AI models frequently comes from non-renewable sources,
contributing to greenhouse gas emissions. Despite the environmental challenges,
AI has the potential to contribute positively to sustainability.
author: Jiji Veronica Kim

title: Machine Learning Basics I Look for in Data Scientist Interviews
subtitle: Let‚Äôs build our breadth of science together.
summary: I recently wrote a post about the mathematics that I look for in our data
scientist interviews. I decided to continue that discussion by going much deeper
into the machine learning knowledge that we expect our data scientists to have
in this post. If you are preparing for a data scientist interview or just plan
to refresh your memory of the related topics, I believe you will find this post
helpful.
author: Farzad Nobar

title: How I outperformed the market by 130% because of artificial intelligence
subtitle: Beating the market is super easy if you‚Äôre not trading $1 billion
summary: Warren Buffet said something that shocked the finance community ‚Äî outperforming
the S&P500 is easy. Because of the size of Berkshire Hathaway, Warren believes
he‚Äôs at a massive structural disadvantage. He claims that if he was trading at a
smaller scale, he could easily outperform the market.
author: Austin Starks

title: Ten Predictions for Data Science and AI in 2025
subtitle: On agents, open source models, safety, and more
summary: At an AI conference at the close of the year, I was in the speakers‚Äô lounge
finishing up my work when three loud AI executives entered just before the
penultimate panel for the day on ‚Äúthe future of AI‚Äù. After a quick glance in my
direction (likely to ensure I was a harmless NPC), one of them loudly proclaimed
‚Äúthis must be my what‚Ä¶30th? 35th? conference this year.‚Äù After a pause he added,
‚Äú‚Ä¶and you know what, they are all starting to sound the same.‚Äù While musing
about installing guardrails...
author: Jason Tamara Widjaja

title: How to Pick Between Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Engineering, ML
Engineering, and SW Engineering
subtitle: Make the right choice for YOU
summary: If you're looking to break into tech or pivot into a new job, figuring out which
career path is right for you isn't easy. The day-to-day work and the type of
person who thrives in each role couldn't be more different.
author: Marina Wyss - Gratitude Driven

summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is no longer a distant concept. It‚Äôs shaping how
industries operate and revolutionizing everything from ecommerce to data
management. But who is behind this disruption, and how do they plan to reshape
the role of AI in our lives? At Tech in Asia Jakarta, we‚Äôre giving you the
chance to meet our team ‚Äî the minds behind the technology.
author: ForU AI

title: Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) For Beginners
subtitle: End-to-end Project Implementation
summary: Developing, deploying, and maintaining machine learning models in production can
be challenging and complex. This is where Machine Learning Operations (MLOps)
comes into play. MLOps is a set of practices that automate and simplify machine
learning (ML) workflows and deployments. In this article, I will be sharing some
basic MLOps practices and tools through an end-to-end project implementation
that will help you manage machine learning projects more efficiently, from
development to...
author: Prasad Mahamulkar
